div.l: For whate so ever this Carpenter answerede
Hit was for nought nomān his resou herde
With othis grete he was swore downe
That he was holde wode in alle the towne
For euery clerke right anone helde wᵗith othir
They seide the mān was wode my leve brothir
And euery wight gan laugh at this striff
Thus swyuede was the carpenters wiff
For alle his kepynge and alle his ielosye
And Absolon hath kyssede her nethir ye
And Nicholas is scaldede in the toute
This tale is done and god saue al this route
Here endeth the Millers tale and
Begynneth the Reves Prologe
Whan folke had ha ha laughen at this nyse caas
Of Absolon and hende Nicholas
Dyuers folke dyuersly they seiden
But for the more they laughden ⁊and pleiden
Ne at this tale I sawe nomān hȳm greue
But yf hit were only Oswalde the Reue
Be cause he was of Carpenters craft
A litle Ire in his hert ys laft
And gan to groucche and blame it alite
Sy the quod he fulle welle I coude hȳm quyte
With blerynge of a proude Millers ye
Yf that me liste to speke of Rebaudrye
But I an olde me liste not to pley forage
Grace tyme is done my foder is forage
This white top writteth myn old yerys
Myn hert also mouled is as myn heere ys
But yf I fare as doth an open ers
That ilke frute is ever the lenger the wers
Tille it be rotened in mollok or in stre
We olde men I drede so fare we
